fields.value: United States Census of Mortality: 1850, 1860, and 1870

authorAffiliation.value: University of Chicago. Center for Population Economics
University of Chicago. Center for Population Economics
University of Chicago. Center for Population Economics
University of Chicago. Center for Population Economics

dsDescriptionValue.value: This data collection is a portion of the historical data  collected by the project, "Early Indicators of Later Work Levels,  Disease, and Death," which is collecting military, medical, and  socioeconomic data on a sample of white males mustered into the Union  Army during the Civil War. During 1850, 1860, and 1870, mortality  information was gathered at the county level as an addendum to the  population census. These data examine the impact of environmental  factors on life outcomes and look at the influence of infectious  disease rates on economic and health patterns at late ages. Part 1,  Disease Data, looks at cause of death from 66 disease  classifications. Part 2, General Disease Data, also examines cause of  death but through 18 broad disease categories. Variables included in  both parts are state, county, year of death, and frequency of death by disease.

topicClassValue.value: ICPSR XVII.G. Social Institutions and Behavior, Vital Statistics
NACDA V. Physical Health and Functioning of Older Adults

fields.value: Version Date: 2006-03-30Version Text: 2006-03-30Version Date: 2006-03-30Version Text: 2006-03-30 Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: File CB2526.ALL.PDF was removed from any previous datasets and flagged as a study-level file, so that it will accompany all downloads.;Version Date: 2005-11-04Version Text: 2005-11-04 Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: On 2005-03-14 new files were added to one  or  more datasets.  These files included additional setup files as well  as one or more of the following: SAS  program, SAS transport, SPSS portable,   and Stata system files. The  metadata record was revised  2005-11-04 to  reflect these additions.; Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: LRECL with SAS, SPSS, and Stata setup files, SAS transport (XPORT) file, SPSS portable file, and Stata system file;Subject: Study Level Error Note, Notes: (1) These files represent a storage format sometimes  referred to as a weighted analysis file. The data are organized with  one record for each county/year/disease permutation (in the event that  no one died in that county/year/disease, no record is created). For  each such permutation, the frequency variable contains the number of  individuals who died in the county/year of that disease. (2) Questions regarding the use of these  data should be directed to Peter Viechnicki at the University of Chicago (peterv@cpe.uchicago.edu).; Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: Stata system file(s), SPSS portable file(s), Data file(s), SAS transport - XPORT engine file(s), and electronic documentation.;
